reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in one of the "Tower" rooms. Large, clean and very nice. $130.00 a night. Location, location, location, this place has it. Good off street parking. Our room was on the third floor, nice. No noise from the street below. An elevator made the trip up easy. Will consider it again when we are in Jackson again.
reviews.title: Location Location Location.

likes.disliked: — Tree dripped sap on my car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in Sept 2008 for one night. On the plus side - it's easy to find, centrally located, with tight but free parking. We had a ground floor room for $122. Not cheap, but compared to some properties in town, it was affordable.
reviews.title: Central Location - Affordable Place to Sleep Compared to Others in Town

reviews.text: The hotel looks kind of scary from the outside. However, once we looked at our room, it was plenty big, with 2 beds, table, 2 chairs, wireless internet, sink outside bathroom. I would describe the furnishings as dated, but they were in good repair. Bed linens were also in good shape.
reviews.title: Not what we expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free continental breakfast was poorly done. Garbage cans overflowing. Only cold items to choose from. Fruit was apples. One of the 3 juice dispenser options was broken.
reviews.title: Ranch Inn Great

reviews.text: We did enjoy the convenience of being able to walk to dinner, then walk about town, and walk back to our hotel in the evening. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We had no problem with the wireless internet, but apparently not all rooms have access, as some people were carrying their laptops to the breakfast nook to get online and explained that they had no access in their rooms.
reviews.title: Clean, inexpensive, and centrally located...perfect for me.
Location, location , location
reviews.text: Great location. Parking is big benefit as the hotel is located right in the center of town and makes everything within walking distance. Staff was very nice and helpful when needed. Rate is the best in town. I was apprehensive because of the rate and pictures on-line but all for naught, because the place is well appointed, clean and comfortable. We stayed an extra day partly because we were so conveniently located and had access to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in one of the basic ground floor rooms for 3 nights in May. It was our base for exploring the Grand Tetons. THe room was very dated but clean. There was a couch and a flat screen TV with plenty of cable stations. The queen bed was not very comfortable but by far not the worst bed I have slept in. The bathroom was clean but smelled like chinese food...I never figured out why.
reviews.title: Very average, but good service

reviews.text: The service at the hotel was excellent all around. The girls at the front desk were outgoing, cheerful and helpful with suggestions in Jackson. The hotel was also 1 block from the historic square and had on site parking...very convenient. It was an excellent base for exploring the Tetons. The continental breakfast was very basic...bagels, muffins, cereal etc. but they put it out around 5-5:30 which was nice so we could get to the park around sunrise. Coffee and juice were offered around the clock which was nice too.
reviews.title: Location, Value, Staff--Couldn't be happier

reviews.text: Noise was an issue once, with the people up stairs but I think they were drunk...
reviews.title: Great place and VERY friendly staff!

reviews.text: Overall I was happy with our choice. It served our needs. At about $85 a night total it was not bad for our location and convenience but I would say a bit overpriced for the room itself. I would stay here again though.
reviews.title: Great location, large rooms & great prices!

reviews.text: Jackson is a very expensive town to stay in so I chose The Ranch Inn because of the middling-price range. The location was good, parking was free, room had fridge & microwave. Nice view from balcony. Those are the good things about this low-budget place.
reviews.title: Adequate is best that can be said..........

likes.liked: — Location close to shops in town.
likes.disliked: — No business center for patrons, some surly, uncaring staff members, poorly handled plumbing crisis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the bad things out-weighed the good. I would say 1/2 the staff members were too crabby to communicate with. The free breakfast was barely worth walking down stairs for. No pool. Worst, was our last evening after returning from a show, we found standing water in the bathroom & soaked carpet thru half the room. Of course any luggage on the floor was water-damaged, as were our things left on the bathroom sink counter.
reviews.title: Nice, but overpriced

likes.disliked: — quality of room / breakfast for price

reviews.text: All we can do is guess that the room upstairs had left their water running or had plugged the drains because it was dirty, gross water that was coming up out of our sink drains and flowing onto all the floor & onto our stuff! The evening staff tried to help and made a good but fruitless effort. We were told that the hotel handyman wouldn't start work till 8:00, despite this emergency. The hotel was full so we couldn't get another room for that night. Luckily the tub & toilet were working, but we couldn't use the sinks at all, (wouldn't drain).
reviews.title: Nice location!
Great Value for Jackson
reviews.text: Next morning we were told that there were no plumbers in Jackson. Probably were, but the hotel couldn't afford to call one. We had to beg to get them to discount the price of that night's stay, even though we think it should have been free for us that night due to the mess this created for us and our inability to use sinks.
I guess this disaster could have happened at any hotel but I think it should have been handled better by the staff. And we certainely should have not had to pay for that soggy night's stay!
reviews.title: Glad we stayed and would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was wonderful, and the location was excellent! It was a block from the Town Square and all the stores and restaurants started outside this hotel....good steakhouse across the street, too! Our room was in the Tower section(newly remodeled) and it had a private balcony facing the road -which was a fun place to have our evening drinks and snacks. The room was absolutely beautiful and spacious....see my photos! Ask for a room overlooking the street with the private balcony...book asap!
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husand and I stayed here two nights in July 2009. The room was unremarkable, just a basic older motel room. On the positive side, it was very clean and the bed was comfortable. They provided Bath and Body soaps and hair products which was a nice touch. It's in the heart of Jackson Hole so you can easily walk anywhere within 5-10 minutes of the motel. Most of the staff are lovely people, especially kind was Jana. The only negative was the WI-FI was very weak from our room. Hubby had to sit on the coffee table next to the window and balance the laptop on the arm of the sofa to get any connection. We would stay here again as the rate was affordable for the Jackson Hole area. Our total with taxes was $121.90 per night, high for what you get but everything is expensive in Jackson.
reviews.title: Basic Room, Great Location and Staff

reviews.text: We stayed one night while on the way to Yellowstone. This motel is located in the heart of the downtown and provides free parking. While the motel is nothing exquisite, its location and roominess of rooms makes it a great deal. I got $5 off the price of the room by going to the "Ranch Inn" website and getting a discount code. I would recommend this motel for anyone looking for a good room at a good price.
reviews.title: Great Location and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a great burger, go to the Cadilac Grill for a Billy Burger.
reviews.title: Met & exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little worried about this hotel before we arrived it seemed to be the lower end of the price scale and I didn't think the outside sold the hotel, however when we arrived the staff were SO friendly and helpful, our room was more than we expected and the location was perfect for staying in Jackson Hole. I have already recommended this hotel to friends & family.
reviews.title: great location, big room, older hotel
